World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.1.A Commitment to Respect Human Rights
Comments: The company states that it promotes human rights, however, a statement in sustainability report is not considered to be a part of formal policy commitment. Also, no evidence found that the company has a publicly available policy statement committing it to respect human rights, which is approved by the highest governance body.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.1.A Commitment to Respect Human Rights+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.10.A Living Wage Targets
Comments: The company states that it promotes competitive pay for its employees, however, it does not disclose if competitive pay is sufficient enough to maintain a decent standard of living for employees and his/her family. Also, no evidence found that the company discloses a time-bound target for paying all workers a living wage.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.10.B Living Wage Determination
Comments: No evidence found that the company describes how it determines a living wage for the regions where it operates.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.10.C Living Wage Business Relationship Support
Comments: The company expects its suppliers to provide wages as per national legal standards or industry benchmark standards, whichever is higher. However, it is unclear if that is enough to maintain a decent standard of living for employees of its business relationships and their family. Also, no evidence found that it discloses how it works to support the payment of a living wage by its business relationships.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 10 Living wage fundamentals
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 10 Living wage fundamentals+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.11.A Fair Working Hours Commitment
Comments: No evidence found that it publicly states that workers shall not be required to work more than 48 hours in a regular work week or 60 hours including overtime.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.11.B Commitment to Fair Overtime
Comments: No evidence found that the company publicly states that all overtime work must be consensual and be paid at a premium rate.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.11.C Fair Working Hours Commitment in Business Relationship Employees
Comments: The company expects its suppliers to comply with local or national laws on working hours. However, it does not disclose the locations of its business relationships. Also, no evidence found that the company has a public expectation that its business relationships shall not require workers to work more than 48 hours in a regular work week or 60 hours including overtime.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 11 Working hours fundamentals
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 11 Working hours fundamentals+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.12.A Collective Bargaining
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses the proportion of its total direct operations workforce covered by collective bargaining agreements.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.12.A Collective Bargaining+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.12.B Collective Bargaining in Business Relationships
Comments: The company expects its suppliers to respect the freedom of its workers to associate and to bargain collectively according to national law. However, no evidence found that the company describes how it works to support the practices of its business relationships in relation to freedom of association and collective bargaining.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.12.B Collective Bargaining in Business Relationships+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 12 Collective bargaining fundamentals
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.13.A Workforce Age Diversity Disclosure
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses the proportion of its total direct operations workforce for each employee category by age group.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.13.B Workforce Gender Diversity Disclosure
Comments: The company discloses the gender of its board of directors and senior management. [Webpage - Our Team] Also, it discloses the proportion of its total workforce by gender. [Sustainability Report 2022, 25]

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.13.C Workforce Race Diversity Disclosure
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses the proportion of its total direct operations workforce for each employee category by race or ethnicity.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.13.D Workforce Other Diversity Disclosure
Comments: The company discloses the educational background of its board of directors and senior management. [Webpage - Our Team] However, no evidence found that the company discloses the proportion of its total direct operations workforce for each employee category by one or more additional indicators of diversity (e.g. disability, sexual identity and marital and family status, etc.).

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 13 Workforce diversity disclosure fundamentals
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 13 Workforce diversity disclosure fundamentals+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.14.A Gender Equality and Women’s Empowerment Commitment
Comments: The company states that it is implementing initiatives to improve equal opportunity for women. Also, it states that it is committed to improving gender equality and ensuring zero gender pay discrimination. Further, it discloses its target to increase women representation in senior leadership. However, no evidence found that the company has public to gender equality and women’s empowerment in broad sense.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.14.B Gender Equality and Women’s Empowerment Targets
Comments: The company discloses its target to achieve at least 40% female senior leadership by 2025 and 40% female leadership by 2030.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.14.C At least 30% Women on Highest Governance Body
Comments: On its website, the company reports that out of 8 board members 4 are female. The percentage of women on board is 50%. [Webpage - Investor Centre]

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.14.D Gender Pay Ratio Disclosure
Comments: The company discloses its gender pay gap for the whole organization i.e. 11.98%. However, no evidence found that the company discloses the ratio of the basic salary and remuneration of women to men in its total direct operations workforce for each employee category, by significant locations of operation.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 14 Gender equality and women’s empowerment fundamentals
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 14 Gender equality and women’s empowerment fundamentals+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.15.A Personal Data Protection Commitment
Comments: The company has a public commitment to protecting personal data of employees and privacy of others, however, it is unclear that the commitment covers protecting personal data of both employees and customers at a minimum.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.15.A Personal Data Protection Commitment+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.15.B Personal Data Protection Policy
Comments: The company has a publicly available policy statement in relation to the collection, sharing and access to personal data, however, the scope of the policy is limited to customers, suppliers and candidates.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.15.B Personal Data Protection Policy+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 15 Personal data protection fundamentals
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.16.A Responsible Tax Strategy
Comments: No evidence found that the company has a publicly available global tax strategy, which is approved by the highest governance body.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.16.B Responsible Tax Strategy Accountability
Comments: No evidence found that a governance body or executive-level position in the company is tasked with accountability for compliance with the company’s global tax strategy.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.16.C Corporate Income Tax Disclosure
Comments: The company discloses its current, deferred and total income tax provisions for the fiscal year 2022. [Annual Report 2022, 126] However, no evidence found that the company clearly discloses the amount of corporate income tax paid for each tax jurisdiction where the company is a resident for tax purposes.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 16 Responsible tax fundamentals
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 16 Responsible tax fundamentals+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.17.A Anti-bribery and Anti-Corruption Policy
Comments: The company has a publicly available policy statement prohibiting bribery and corruption.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 17 Anti-bribery and anti-corruption fundamentals
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 17 Anti-bribery and anti-corruption fundamentals+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.17.B Anti-bribery and Anti-Corruption Process
Comments: The company discloses that its personnel must continually assess the vulnerability of their business activities to risks of Bribery and Corruption. Also, it states that its management must take the required actions to establish an efficient system of internal control and monitoring to prevent bribery and corruption, however, no evidence found that the company describes the process to identify its bribery and corruption risks and impacts in specific locations or activities covering its own operations.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.17.C Anti-bribery and Anti-Corruption In Contractual Agreements
Comments: The company has a supplier code of conduct in which it prohibits bribery and corruption, and it states that its supplier contracts/relationships will or could be terminated as a result of breach of the code of conduct or bribery and corruption.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.17.D Anti-bribery and Anti-Corruption Complaint Mechanism
Comments: The company discloses an email address, phone numbers and mail address for reporting grievances without fear of reprisals. Also, it states that anyone with information about potential misconduct is encouraged to raise complaints or concerns related to the company and there is a choice for the complainant to either remain anonymous or identify themselves.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.18.A Responsible Lobbying and Political Engagement Policy
Comments: The company states that its employees may participate voluntarily in the political process as an individual, however, no evidence found that the company has a publicly available policy statement or policy setting out its lobbying and political engagement approach.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.18.B Political Contributions Policy
Comments: The company has a publicly available policy statement that specifies that it is against Group policy to use corporate funds for political purposes. Also, it states that its personnel must not make any political contributions to candidates for any political office outside Australia on behalf of the company, and all political donations must have prior approval from the CEO. However, no evidence found that it specifies that it does not make political contributions or that it clearly states the criteria for making exceptions.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.18.C Lobbying Expenditures Disclosure
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses its expenditures on lobbying activities.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.18.D Third-Party Political Lobbying and Engagement Policy
Comments: No evidence found that the company requires third-party lobbyists to comply with its lobbying and political engagement policy (or policies).

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 18 Responsible lobbying and political engagement fundamentals
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 18 Responsible lobbying and political engagement fundamentals+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.2.A Commitment to Respect the Human Rights of Workers
Comments: The company has a publicly available policy statement committing it to respect the right not to be the subject of discrimination. Further, it states that it prohibits all forms of slavery, exploitation, human trafficking and child labour in its modern slavery statement, however, a statement in modern slavery cannot be considered as a policy commitment. Also, no evidence found that the company has a publicly available policy statement committing it to respecting the human rights that the ILO has declared to be fundamental rights at work, which is approved by the highest governance body i.e., right not to be subject to child labor, forced labour and respecting the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.2.A Commitment to Respect the Human Rights of Workers+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.2.B Business Relationship Commitment to Respect the Human Rights of Workers
Comments: The company has a public policy that explicitly requires its suppliers to prohibit forced labour, child labour, and discrimination in respect of employment and occupation. Also, it states that workers have the right to join or form trade unions of their own choosing and to bargain collectively according to national law, however, it is not clear whether the company expects its suppliers to respect freedom of association and collective bargaining, in all contexts and locations, as the company indicates that it expects its business to respect these rights 'according to national law'.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.2.B Business Relationship Commitment to Respect the Human Rights of Workers+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.2 Commitment to respect the human rights of workers
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.3.A Identifying Human Rights Risk and Impacts
Comments: The company states that it identifies human rights risks in its operations and supply chain. Also, it states that it conducted materiality assessment in 2017 to identify the main risks to the business and it has identified human rights broadly as a material issue. However, no evidence found that the company describes the process to identify its human rights risks and impacts in specific locations or activities covering its own operations.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.3.A Identifying Human Rights Risk and Impacts+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.3.B Identifying Business Partner Human Rights Risk and Impacts
Comments: The company states that it conducts due diligence to identify risks related to human rights and modern slavery in its supply chain. Also, it describes the process to identify the modern slavery risk in its supply chain. However, no evidence found that the company describes the process to identify its human rights risks and impacts in specific locations or activities through relevant business relationships.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.3.B Identifying Business Partner Human Rights Risk and Impacts+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 3 Identifying human rights risk and impacts
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.4.A Assessing Human Rights Risks and Impacts Processes
Comments: No evidence found that the company describes its process for assessing its human rights risks and discloses what it considers to be its salient human rights issues. This description includes how relevant factors are taken into account, such as geographical, economic, social and other factors.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 4 Assessing human rights risks and impacts
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 4 Assessing human rights risks and impacts+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.4.B Assessing Human Rights Risks and Impacts Results
Comments: No evidence found that the company publicly discloses the results of its assessments, which may be aggregated across its operations and locations.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.5.A Integrating and Acting on Human Rights Risk and Impact Assessments
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses what it considers to be its salient human rights risks (meeting 4a or 4b) and it is, therefore, unable to meet this element, which requires a global system to take action to prevent, mitigate or remediate its salient human rights risks, which must be transparently shared.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.5.B Integrating and Acting on Human Rights Risk and Impact Assessments Specific Conclusions
Comments: No evidence found that the company provides an example of the specific conclusions reached and actions taken or to be taken on at least one of its salient human rights issues as a result of assessment processes in at least one of its activities/operations in the last three years.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 5 Integrating and acting on human rights risk and impact assessments
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 5 Integrating and acting on human rights risk and impact assessments+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.6.A Engaging with Affected and Potentially Affected Stakeholders
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses the categories of stakeholders whose human rights have been or may be affected by its activities.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.6.A Engaging with Affected and Potentially Affected Stakeholders+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.6.B Engaging with Affected and Potentially Affected Stakeholders Examples
Comments: No evidence found that the company provides at least two examples of its engagement with stakeholders whose human rights have been or may be affected by its activities (or their legitimate representatives or multi-stakeholder initiatives) in the last two years.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.6.B Engaging with Affected and Potentially Affected Stakeholders Examples+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 6 Engaging with affected and potentially affected stakeholders
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.7.A Grievance Mechanisms for Workers
Comments: The company discloses an email address, phone numbers and mail address for reporting grievances. Also, it states that the channel is accessible to all workers to raise complaints or concerns related to the company and there is a choice for the complainant to either remain anonymous or identify themselves.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.7.A Grievance Mechanisms for Workers+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.8.A Grievance Mechanisms for External Individuals and communities
Comments: The company discloses an email address, phone numbers and mail address for reporting grievances. Also, it states that the channel is accessible to all external individuals and communities to raise complaints or concerns related to the company and there is a choice for the complainant to either remain anonymous or identify themselves.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.8.A Grievance Mechanisms for External Individuals and communities+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.9.A Health and Safety Commitment
Comments: The company has a publicly available policy statement committing it to respect the health and safety of workers.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.9.B Health and Safety Quantitative Disclosure
Comments: The company reports the lost time injury frequency rate (LTIFR) and total recordable injury frequency rate (TRIFR) of employees. [Sustainability Report 2022, 18] However, it does not disclose the number and rate of fatalities as a result of work-related injuries, the total number of hours worked, the number and rate of high-consequence work-related injuries (excluding fatalities) and the main types of work-related injuries.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.9.C Health and Safety Business Relationship Commitment
Comments: The company has a publicly available statement of policy that expects its business relationships to commit to respecting the health and safety of their workers.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI.9.D Health and Safety Business Relationship Monitoring
Comments: The company discloses that it regularly reviews and evaluates the health and safety laws and codes that apply to its suppliers under this code of conduct. However, no evidence found that the company discloses how it monitors the health and safety performance of its business relationships.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 9 Health and safety fundamentals
World Benchmarking Alliance+CSI 9 Health and safety fundamentals+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group

World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A01.EA Sustainability Strategy Disclosure
Comments: The company discloses that to identify and prioritise the issues relevant to its organisation, it has reviewed its 2017 materiality assessment industry reports, peers’ sustainability reports and performance, and employee feedback gathered through surveys and interviews. Further, it discloses its material topics. [Sustainability Report 2022, 8] However, no evidence found that it disclosed a process that meets double materiality. Also, no evidence found that it had involved external stakeholders in its materiality assessment.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A01.EB Sustainability Strategy Coverage
Comments: No evidence that the company's sustainability strategy covers most of its key sustainability topics could be found in the public domain.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A01.EC Group-Wide Sustainability Strategy
Comments: The company has group-wide targets on key sustainability topics i.e. climate, social and water. However, no evidence found that the has group-wide targets on biodiversity, Nutrition, social inclusion, Ecosystem conversion, and Soil health.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A01.ED Sustainability Strategy Reporting
Comments: The company reports progress against its target to increase women in senior leadership, reduce GHG emission, reduce water intensity and reduce landfill waste.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A01 Sustainability Strategy
World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A01 Sustainability Strategy+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A02 Accountability for Sustainable Strategy
World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A02 Accountability for Sustainable Strategy+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A02.EA Responsibility for Sustainable Strategy
Comments: The company discloses that it has a Risk and Sustainability Committee, which is responsible for the company's sustainability strategy and its implementation plans. Further, it discloses that its sustainability strategy responsibilities includes overseeing sustainability and climate change risks, including both physical and transitional risks, reviewing and approving sustainability reporting and the company’s sustainability strategy, and reviewing progress against 2030 targets and commitments, which includes environmental and social targets.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A02.EB Accountability for Sustainable Strategy Assignation
Comments: The company discloses that the Risk and Sustainability Committee and the company's board of directors have decision-making and oversight responsibility for its sustainability strategy.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A02.EC Accountability for Sustainable Strategy Remuneration
Comments: The company discloses that 20% of its short-term incentive plan comprises non-financial measures, which includes people safety and food safety metrics. However, no evidence found that the company links performance criteria in senior executives’ remuneration policies to targets and objectives that address both environmental and social issues.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A02.ED Accountability for Sustainable Strategy Evidence
Comments: No evidence found that the company's highest governance body has expertise in at least five out of the seven sustainability topics i.e. biodiversity, nutrition, social inclusion, climate, water, ecosystem conversion and soil health.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A03.EA Stakeholder Engagement Issue Disclosure
Comments: The company discloses that it gathers data on stakeholders' expectations as a part of its materiality assessment. However, no evidence found that the company discloses an overview of the issues raised during its ongoing and regular stakeholder engagement activities.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A03.EB Stakeholder Engagement Identification
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses its process for identifying relevant stakeholders across its value chain.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A03.EC Stakeholder Engagement Process Disclosure
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses its process for engaging with stakeholder groups, including frequency and channels, beyond its materiality assessment or an equivalent.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A03.ED Stakeholder Engagement Outcomes
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses the outcomes of its stakeholder engagement activities and their integration into its sustainability strategy.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A03.EE Stakeholder Engagement Coverage
Comments: No evidence found that the company’s stakeholder engagement covers its most material sustainability topics.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A03 Stakeholder Engagement
World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A03 Stakeholder Engagement+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A04.EA Lobbying and Advocacy Trade Associations Disclosure
Comments: No evidence found that the company’s stakeholder engagement covers its most material sustainability topics.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A04.EB Lobbying and Advocacy Assessment Framework
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses a clear and detailed framework for assessing alignment of its trade associations with its sustainability targets.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A04.EC Lobbying and Advocacy Framework Application
Comments: No evidence found that the company provides evidence of annually applying the framework across all trade associations

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A04.ED Lobbying and Advocacy Misalignment Reporting
Comments: No evidence found that the company reports any misalignment between the lobbying activities of its trade associations and its sustainability targets.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A04.EE Lobbying and Advocacy Misalignment Escalation Action Plan
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses an action plan to address misalignment which includes clear escalation steps.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A04.EF Lobbying and Advocacy Misalignment Escalation Action Plan Deadlines
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses clear deadlines for each of its escalation steps and consistently reports on their application.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A04.EG Lobbying and Advocacy Annual Review Disclosure
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses an annual review of all the advocacy activities it has undertaken.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A04 Lobbying and advocacy
World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A04 Lobbying and advocacy+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A05.EA Circular and Nature-Positive Transition Assessment
Comments: No evidence found that the company assesses the risks and opportunities related to the transition to a circular economy and determines the impacts of staying in a linear economy.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A05.EB Circular and Nature-Positive Transition Group-Level Evidence
Comments: The company discloses that it is targeting TCFD-aligned opportunities in the circular economy for internal supply chains by 2023 through reduce costs, increase climate resilience, increase environmental performance, increase reliability, and reduce waste. However, no evidence found that the company provides evidence of integrating circularity in its strategy at the group level.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A05.EC Circular and Nature-Positive Transition Strategy Disclosure
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses a strategy that would lead its business model to become nature positive, which includes a timeframe in line with milestones for halting biodiversity loss (no net loss) and reversing the trend (biodiversity net gain).

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.A05.ED Circular and Nature-Positive Transition Mitigation Hierarchy
Comments: No evidence found that the company applies a mitigation hierarchy approach to its biodiversity targets.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B01 Assessments of impacts on nature
World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B01 Assessments of impacts on nature+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B01.EA Assessment of Impacts on Nature
Comments: The company discloses that it conducts environmental impact assessments. Also, it is a member of the local chapter of the Sustainable Agriculture Initiative (SAI), participating in their working groups. However, no evidence found that the company assesses its impacts on nature, including biodiversity, within its own operations.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B01.EB Assessment of Impacts on Nature Upstream Value Chain
Comments: No evidence found that the company assesses its impacts on nature, including biodiversity, in the upstream activities of its value chain.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B01.EC Assessment of Impacts on Nature Downstream Value Chain
Comments: No evidence found that the company assesses its impacts on nature, including biodiversity, in the downstream activities of its value chain.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B01.ED Assessment of Impacts on Nature Stakeholder Assessment
Comments: No evidence found that the company assesses whether its impacts on nature, including biodiversity, contribute to a cumulative effect, with other stakeholders, on the locations within its own operations.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B01.EE Assessment of Impacts on Nature Including Biodiversity
Comments: No evidence found that the company quantifies its impacts on nature, including biodiversity.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B02 Assessment of dependencies on nature
World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B02 Assessment of dependencies on nature+World Benchmarking Alliance Research Group
World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B02.EA Assessment of Dependencies on Nature
Comments: The company states that it relies on healthy ecosystems. However, no evidence found that the company assesses its dependencies on nature within its own operations.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B02.EB Assessment of Dependencies on Nature Upstream Value Chain
Comments: No evidence found that the company assesses dependencies on nature of its upstream business relationships.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B02.EC Assessment of Dependencies on Nature Downstream Value Chain
Comments: No evidence found that the company assesses dependencies on nature of its downstream business relationships.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B02.ED Assessment of Dependencies on Nature Quantification
Comments: No evidence found that the company quantifies its dependencies on nature in its own operations.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B03.EA Location Disclosure
Comments: The company discloses its facilities and farms across Australia and New Zealand. However, the map lacks sufficient details. Also, no evidence found that the company discloses all the locations (owned and controlled) where they conduct activities.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B03.EB Key Areas Important for Biodiversity Disclosure
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses the locations that are in or adjacent to areas important for biodiversity within its own operations.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B03.EC Key Areas Important for Biodiversity Upstream Relationships
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses the locations of its upstream business relationships, including suppliers, that are in or adjacent to areas important to biodiversity.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B03.ED Key Areas Important for Biodiversity Management Plan
Comments: No evidence found that the company has a management plan for locations within its own operations adjacent to areas important to biodiversity, and discloses the percentage of land, fresh water and sea use in such locations.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B03 Key areas important for biodiversity

Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses details and outcomes of ecosystem restoration projects in areas affected by its own operations or upstream business relationships.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B07.EB Resource Exploitation and Circularity Performance Input Disclosure

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B09.EB Water Withdrawal Reduction Target
Comments: The company discloses its target to reduce water intensity of its products. However, no evidence found that the company has a target to reduce water withdrawal across its own operations and reports progress against the target.

Comments: No evidence found that the company provides evidence of dependency on water-stressed areas across its own operations.

World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B12.EA Plastic Use and Waste Reduction Qualitative Evidence
Comments: The company states that it is committed to reducing its environmental impact by improving the recyclability and increasing recycled content in its packaging. Further, it has set 2025 targets that align with the ambition of the Australian Packaging Covenant, of which it is a Signatory.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B12.EB Plastic Use and Waste Reduction Quantitative Evidence
Comments: The Company provides quantitative evidence of reducing plastic use and transitioning to more sustainable forms of packaging. However, it should disclose more information on the topic.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B12.EC Plastic Use and Waste Reduction Targets
Comments: The company discloses its target to use 100% reusable, recyclable or compostable packaging, however, no evidence found that the company has targets on one or more of the following, and reports progress against it: (i) reduction in percentage of overall plastic use, (ii) reduction in percentage of virgin plastic use or (iii) increase in the proportion of reusable or refillable packaging.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B12.ED Plastic Use Reporting
Comments: The company discloses that 90% of its packaging is reusable, recyclable, or compostable. However, no precise information on plastic could be found.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B12.EE Plastic Waste Reporting
Comments: No evidence found that the company reports on the amount of plastic waste generated, and proportions directed from or to disposal.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B12.EG Plastic Use and Waste Reduction Evidence Downstream
Comments: No evidence found that the company provides evidence of actions to reduce plastic and waste in its downstream activities.

Comments: No evidence found that the company reports regularly against these targets.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B14.EA Scope 1 and 2 Greenhouse Gas Emissions Reductions
Comments: The company discloses quantitative reductions for its scope 1 and 2 emissions. [Sustainability Report 2022, 30]

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B14.EB Scope 1 and 2 Greenhouse Gas Emissions Targets
Comments: The company reports its target to reduce Scope 1 and Scope 2 absolute GHG emissions by 43% by 2030 against the FY19 baseline.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B14.EC Scope 1 and 2 Greenhouse Gas Emissions Targets Reporting
Comments: The company reports that it reduces its FY22 absolute Scope 1 and Scope 2 GHG emissions (tCO2-e) by 6.8% against FY19.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.B14.ED Scope 1 and 2 Greenhouse Gas Emissions 1.5°C Alignment
Comments: The company discloses that its scope 1 and scope 2 SBTs will be based on the 1.5-degree pathway. Further, it discloses that its target will be submitted to the SBT initiative for validation by June 2023.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.C02.EB Indigenous People' Rights Impact Identification
Comments: No evidence found that the company discloses its processes to identify and recognise the rights of Indigenous Peoples when activities in its own operations may impact their rights AND describes how it obtains Indigenous Peoples’ free, prior and informed consent regarding whether and how to carry out projects.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.C02.EC Business Relationships & Indigenous People' Rights Requirements

World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.C03.EA Land Rights Commitment
Comments: No evidence found that the company has a commitment to respect ownership and use of land and natural resources and related legitimate tenure rights, as set out in the relevant part(s) of the CFS Voluntary Guidelines on the Responsible Governance of Tenure of Land, Fisheries and Forests in the Context of National Food Security (VGGTs), or the IFC Performance Standards.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.C03.EB Land Acquisition Engagement
Comments: No evidence found that the company, when acquiring, leasing land or making other arrangements to use or restrict the use or access to land or natural resources, discloses its processes to (i) identify legitimate tenure rightsholders, including through engagement with affected communities in the process, paying particular attention to vulnerable or marginalised tenure rightsholders, and (ii) negotiate with them to provide adequate compensation.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.C03.EC Business Relationships Requirements of Land Rights
Comments: No evidence found that the company requires its business relationships to have a process to identify legitimate tenure rightsholders when acquiring, leasing or making other arrangements to use land, paying particular attention to vulnerable or marginalised tenure rightsholders, and to negotiate with them to provide adequate compensation.

Metric: World Benchmarking Alliance+NAT.C03.ED Business Relationships Land Rights Practices
Comments: No evidence was found that the company works with its business relationships to improve its practices on land use and acquisition.

Comments: No evidence found that the company requires access to water and sanitation, including refraining from negatively affecting access to safe water, to be included in contractual arrangements with its business relationships.

Comments: No evidence found that the company works with its business relationships to improve their practices on access to water and sanitation.
